description: Each observation represents a single patient observed during a single year. The pair (id.patient, year) serves as a unique identifier in the ACIC 2022 patient-level track.

variables.name: id.patient
variables.description: Unique patient identifier. Together with 'year' forms a unique key for each row. Stored as an integer but can be cast to string for joins or display.

variables.name: id.practice
variables.description: Identifier of the primary care practice to which the patient belongs. Stored as an integer but can be cast to string for joins or display.

variables.name: Z
variables.description: Practice-level treatment indicator: Z = 1 if practice id.practice is in the treatment group, Z = 0 if in the comparison group.

variables.name: year
variables.description: Observation year (1–4). Years 1–2 form the pre-intervention period; years 3–4 form the post-intervention period.

variables.name: post
variables.description: Indicator for intervention period: post = 1 in years 3 and 4 (intervention active), post = 0 in years 1 and 2 (pre-intervention).

variables.name: Y
variables.description: Outcome: monthly Medicare expenditures for patient id.patient in the given year. Highly skewed, with a small fraction of patients incurring very high costs.

variables.name: X1
variables.description: Binary practice-level covariate used (together with X2–X5) to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: X2
variables.description: Unordered categorical practice-level covariate (3 levels) used to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: X3
variables.description: Binary practice-level covariate used to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: X4
variables.description: Unordered categorical practice-level covariate (3 levels) used to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: X5
variables.description: Binary practice-level covariate used to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: X6
variables.description: Additional practice-level covariate (continuous). Not used to define official subgroup SATT estimands, but may affect treatment assignment and outcomes.

variables.name: X7
variables.description: Additional practice-level covariate (continuous). Not used to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: X8
variables.description: Additional practice-level covariate (continuous). Not used to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: X9
variables.description: Additional practice-level covariate (continuous). Not used to define official subgroup SATT estimands.

variables.name: V1
variables.description: Continuous patient-level covariate (e.g., reflecting individual health status or utilization patterns).

variables.name: V2
variables.description: Continuous patient-level covariate.

variables.name: V3
variables.description: Binary patient-level covariate.

variables.name: V4
variables.description: Continuous patient-level covariate.

variables.name: V5
variables.description: Unordered categorical patient-level covariate with 3 categories. Does not define official subgroup SATTs in the challenge, but may influence treatment and outcomes.

description.text: In the datasets for the patient-level track, each observation represents a single patient observed during a single year. The pair (id.patient, year) serves as a unique identifier. The datasets contain the following variables: id.patient, id.practice, Z, year, post, Y, X1–X5, X6–X9, V1–V5.

official_subgroup_satt_definition.description: In the ACIC 2022 challenge, the organizers only requested subgroup SATT estimates for subgroups defined by the practice-level covariates X1–X5 (e.g., SATT(X1 = 1), SATT(X2 = level A/B/C), etc.).
official_subgroup_satt_definition.implication: X1–X5 define the subgroup structure for which ground-truth SATTs were released and for which estimates can be directly evaluated against known targets. Other covariates (X6–X9, V1–V5) can and should be used for adjustment, modeling, and exploration of effect heterogeneity, and in principle one can define subgroup SATTs based on them as well. However, for these additional subgroup estimands no official ground-truth values are available, so their performance cannot be validated in the same way as for the X1–X5-based subgroups.
